Key Match Events: South Africa beat the United States by 18 runs in the first T20 World Cup Super 8 game in Antigua.
Kagiso Rabada took three vital wickets, finishing with figures of 3-18.
Quinton de Kock scored 74 runs, reaching his half-century in 26 balls.
De Kock and Aiden Markram shared a 110-run partnership off 60 deliveries.
Harmeet Singh dismissed Quinton de Kock and David Miller in consecutive deliveries.
Heinrich Klaasen scored a quick-fire 36 in an unbroken 53-run partnership with Tristan Stubbs.
US opener Andries Gous scored 80 not out.
Rabada dismissed US opener Steven Taylor, Nitish Kumar, and Harmeet Singh.
US captain Aaron Jones fell for a duck to spinner Keshav Maharaj.
Post-Match Reflections: Player of the match Quinton de Kock commented on the tricky wickets leading up to the game.
US captain Aaron Jones expressed disappointment over the defeat, mentioning the need for more disciplined bowling.
